snippet: By one gauge, stock prices have been lofty for years. But that doesn’t mean they’ll stay there.
abstract: The Upshot; Robert J Shiller Economic View column notes that stock-price measure known as the CAPE ratio is hovering at a rare and worrisome level, similar to what has preceded major market drops in the past; holds that just because stock prices have been lofty for years does not mean that phenomenon will continue.
lead_paragraph: By one gauge, stock prices have been lofty for years. But that doesn’t mean they’ll stay there.

headline.main: The Mystery of Lofty Stock Market Elevations
